file_content.text: Attention Republic citizens... the Galactic Senate Health and Safety Council has issued an infectious disease alert.
Attention Republic citizens... the Galactic Senate Health and Safety Council has updated its infectious disease alert.
Attention Republic citizens... the Interstellar Travel Council has issued a Level One Emergency Alert for the planet Tatooine.
Attention Republic citizens... the Health and Safety Council reminds you that victims of rakghoul plague are a danger to your well-being.
There are unconfirmed reports that the rakghoul plague has spread beyond the Taris system.
Victims of rakghoul plague suffer fever, body aches and genetic mutation. If left untreated, the victim becomes dangerous to nearby life forms.
If you see anyone suffering from rakghoul plague, do not approach. Report the victim's location to the Health and Safety Council immediately.
Rakghoul plague outbreaks are now confirmed in Republic, Imperial and unaligned systems. A complete list of infected planets will be released shortly.
Citizens are encouraged to remain in their homes or aboard their starships. Anyone displaying symptoms of rakghoul plague should be quarantined immediately.
Once again, a major rakghoul plague outbreak has been confirmed in multiple systems. Citizens are advised to use extreme caution.
A serious rakghoul plague outbreak has been confirmed on the planet. Tatooine officials report significant loss of life and a high rate of infection.
For their own safety and the safety of others, all citizens are warned to avoid Tatooine until further notice. Thank you for your cooperation.
In extreme cases of infection, rakghoul plague victims will attack and attempt to devour their own loved ones.
If you cannot restrain or isolate a rakghoul, run away. If you cannot escape, use appropriate force to defend yourself against infection.
